p: T. scandens is an evergreen shrub that grows to 2 m in height. In thickets, the plant usually grows as a woody climber, reaching up to 30 m. It has simple, petiolate leaves that are arranged in opposite pairs along the stem. Moreover, the leaf blade is characterized by its ovate shape, leathery and scabrous texture, serrated margin, and acute apex [ Figure 1]. The new leaves are reddish-pink in color before turning green upon maturation.[ 6]
